findings.title: Iterations over variable-sized data structure may cause critical functions to fail if too many tokens registered
findings.description: The `GalleonPool` contract stores `asset` in a linked list. Iterations over this data structure in functions like `removeToken()`, `syncAll()`, `withdraw()`, and `invariant()` may hit the block gas limit, leading to transaction reverts if too many tokens are registered.

findings.title: GalleonPool.sol: Non-enforcement of ETH as the last element in the linked list may break escape protection
findings.description: The `escape()` function relies on assuming the ETH token entry will be inserted first, but there is no enforcement in the codebase to ensure this, which may break escape protection.
